meanings.definition: Capable of being pressed down or lowered in position.
meanings.sent1: The sponge is depressible when you squeeze it.
meanings.sent2: The balloon is depressible as you let the air out.
meanings.sent3: The depressible mattress made it feel like I was sinking into a cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits were depressible, like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The depressible button on the elevator was easy to push.

meanings.definition: Able to be reduced in force, intensity, or value.
meanings.sent1: The volume on the TV is depressible with the remote.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm was depressible after the long meeting.
meanings.sent3: The price of the toy was so depressible that I bought two!
meanings.sent4: Her anger was depressible, like a storm fading away.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was depressible, like a balloon slowly deflating.
